name: nytimes
text:
"My body’s a body bag. Stuffed with pain, hot gravel and me. It hurts. Breathing hurts. Not breathing hurts. Everything bloody hurts."

Read "If Wishes Was Horses," a new short story by David Mitchell, written for @NYTmag’s Decameron Project. https://t.co/dtxO6V08Qp

name: nytimes
text: RT @nytopinion: "Attacks from self-serving, insecure men who can’t tell the difference between true patriotism and hateful nationalism will never diminish my love for this country," @SenDuckworth writes. https://t.co/5bB8G2X9p0

name: nytimes
text: After more than 4 months of coronavirus lockdown, 4 NYC zoos and the New York Aquarium are preparing to open to the public on July 24 at limited capacity https://t.co/Cvdf0eSSDY

name: nytimes
text: RT @charlie_savage: Two House hearings grappled with a C.I.A. assessment that Russia offered payments to kill American troops in Afghanistan — and White House inaction on the months-old judgment. w/ @EricSchmittNYT  https://t.co/gA2DAbjv5E

name: nytimes
text:
“Inside one of the cave’s deepest and darkest chambers, which explorers have named the Abyss, you can hear echoes of your own beating heart.”

Read “One Thing,” a new short story by Edwidge Danticat, written for @NYTmag’s Decameron Project. https://t.co/y0r7k2zX4D https://t.co/gbXgTB2Z6F

name: nytimes
text:
RT @cliffordlevy: NEW: Occupy City Hall organizers said they were helping vulnerable homeless people. But nearby residents said the camp had turned into an unruly — and at times violent — shantytown.
https://t.co/0Zp9mFCo8o
By @alanfeuer @julianahyekim

name: nytimes
text:
A group of American scientists dropped everything to find a Covid-19 treatment. Then they found themselves in one of the biggest virus hot spots.
https://t.co/6iP1HjP4To

name: nytimes
text:
RT @motokorich: A tragedy unfolds: as rains started, the village of Kuma, Kyushu issued an evacuation warning, but residents of the Sejuen nursing home were left in place. Hours later, the river burst, flooded the home, & 14 died as caregivers scrambled to save the aging
https://t.co/KiZgCEXONc

name: nytimes
text: Students, women’s rights and education groups are suing to block Education Secretary Betsy DeVos’s campus sexual assault rules from taking effect next month https://t.co/v6I8fhJgz6

name: nytimes
text:
RT @mariecfazio: NEW: An LA Sheriff's Dept. investigation confirmed that Robert Fuller, who was found hanging on a tree in a city park, committed suicide. 
Fuller's family had called for a deeper investigation after authorities initially ruled it a suicide in June. 
https://t.co/yum1C8S8aW

name: nytimes
text: “It’s incredible to me that the federal government would see the necessity of bailing out airlines and banks,” a fifth-grade teacher in San Diego said, “and not see the need to do something similar for the public schools in this country” https://t.co/FVos0FLmOD

name: nytimes
text:
More than 59,460 new cases were announced across the U.S. on Thursday, setting a single-day record for the sixth time in 10 days, according to a New York Times database.  

Latest updates:
https://t.co/ryQ5iZCoxr

name: nytimes
text: A mail carrier in West Virginia pleaded guilty to attempted election fraud. 5 mail-in ballot requests were altered from Democrat to Republican with black ink, federal prosecutors said. https://t.co/Cchxb1BUhL

name: nytimes
text: RT @peterbakernyt: The court’s categorical rejection of Trump’s claim of “absolute immunity,” including Trump’s two appointees, served as a reminder that institutional prerogatives still matter in Washington, even in a time of extreme partisanship. https://t.co/3JARBQo2Qi

name: nytimes
text: Florida is struggling with one of the worst outbreaks in the U.S., along with Texas, California and Arizona: 43 intensive care units in 21 Florida counties have hit capacity and have no beds available. https://t.co/cTXV0g4Jjm

name: nytimes
text: RT @NYTHealth: The W.H.O. agrees the coronavirus is airborne indoors, and people should avoid crowded and confined spaces with poor ventilation. https://t.co/Ht3b2BQchb

name: nytimes
text: “Ultimately I’m not trying to make any of my guests look bad,” the comedian Ziwe Fumudoh said. “I’m just trying to start a really productive and healthy conversation that promotes healing with the trauma that is our racist history of this country.” https://t.co/gJNJqibpt9

name: nytimes
text: RT @BenWeiserNYT: “No citizen, not even the president, is categorically above the common duty to produce evidence when called upon in a criminal proceeding.” @AdamLiptak on the court's ruling that Trump can't block the release of his financial records https://t.co/zV9f4oEk5A

name: nytimes
text: The mayor of Seoul, the country’s second-most powerful official and a potential presidential candidate, was found dead just days after a secretary in his office told the police that he had sexually harassed her since 2017 https://t.co/5gCOcbY3YD

name: nytimes
text: Europe morning briefing: Here's what you need to know to start your day https://t.co/eBVkzH071u

name: nytimes
text:
Once a year, millions of high school seniors in China take the most important test of their lives: the university entrance exam known as the gaokao. This year they braved virus restrictions and severe floods.

Live updates from the pandemic: https://t.co/4KTDFuhjIT

name: nytimes
text: It carried its children in a pouch like a kangaroo, and had blades in its mouth like a saber-tooth cat. But this creature turns out to have been less of a super-ambush predator and more of a scavenger. https://t.co/HoxsP9VZNu

name: nytimes
text: Climate change has spurred more torrential rains in Japan, causing deadly flooding and mudslides. The people most vulnerable to the risks of this extreme weather are the elderly, of which Japan has the highest proportion in the world. https://t.co/MuySuGHyPE

name: nytimes
text: After Choi Suk-hyeon, a South Korean triathlete, killed herself, her family released a diary and secret recordings that depict the physical and psychological abuse she appeared to suffer at the hands of her team’s doctor and coach https://t.co/8RcdJubU9x

name: nytimes
text:
RT @MatinaStevis: Love is Essential!

The agonized cry of couples separated by coronavirus travel bans is supported by @YlvaJohansson, but only 2 EU govts are letting non-married partners reunite for now.

@meganspecia reports @nytimes 

https://t.co/v1oxcm5q1a

#loveisessential #LoveIsNotTourism

name: nytimes
text: A man living in Vienna said on TV that there was a price on his head, and he was an informer for the authorities about Russian murder-for-hire plots. He was killed last weekend. https://t.co/IXdEDilvy5

name: nytimes
text: For 32 years, a NASA rocket testing center in Mississippi has carried the name of John C. Stennis, a former U.S. senator who was a champion of racial segregation. Now a campaign is urging NASA to rename the center. https://t.co/wmGjFanBBe

name: nytimes
text: Notre-Dame in Paris will be rebuilt with a spire like the one destroyed in last year's fire, not a modern one, President Emmanuel Macron said, bowing to public opinion and time pressure https://t.co/lg7SJHmGLL

name: nytimes
text: Anna Lindstedt, a former Swedish ambassador, was found not guilty of overstepping the boundaries of her role when she arranged secret meetings over the fate of a Hong Kong bookseller and Swedish citizen who remains detained in China https://t.co/1qC93qSGCm
